DataElement.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Solitary Plasmacytoma Risk Assessment Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The category used to describe risk assessment of a subject with solitary plasmacytoma.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Solitary Plasmacytoma Risk Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to the risk assessment of a subject with solitary plasmacytoma.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: A localized clonal (malignant) plasma cell infiltrate either in the bone or in another anatomic site without peripheral blood involvement.:The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: A localized malignant neoplasm that arises in the bony skeleton or soft tissue. It is composed of clonal (malignant) plasma cells forming a tumor mass.
The potential future harm that may arise from some present action. It is often combined or confused with the probability of an event which is seen as undesirable.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
